thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: South African police tap Interpol to help with Steinhoff investigation

title: South African police tap Interpol to help with Steinhoff investigation
text:
January 31, 2018 / 11:34 AM / in 22 minutes South African police tap Interpol to help with Steinhoff investigation Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
JOHANNESBURG, Jan 31 (Reuters) - South Africa’s specialist Hawks police unit opened a case to investigate Steinhoff in December and has sought the help of Interpol in investigating the troubled company, its spokesman said on Wednesday. 
Police were yet to question any of Steinhoff’s staff, or visit the company’s offices to carry out investigations, Hawks spokesman Hangwani Mulaudzi told Reuters. 
“We have written to Interpol seeking assistance in investigating Steinhoff’s activities abroad,” Maulaudzi said. 
Steinhoff said earlier that it had reported its former chief executive Markus Jooste to the Hawks unit over suspected corruption. (Reporting by James Macharia. Editing by Jane Merriman)
